resources.string: "An influential center that hosts cultural events and exhibitions by local artists and academics."
"Av. Republica e/ Chile y Alberdi, Asuncion"
"Metropolitan Cathedral of Our Lady of the Assumption"
"Also known Asunción Cathedral, it is the main Catholic church in Asunción. It is dedicated to Our Lady of the Assumption, Asunción's patroness."
"Houses the city zoo, a nature reserve, and former residential properties of the López dynasty."

"Where the government currently sits. In the early days of independence one could be executed by wandering and looking at the palace's exterior. Photos could be taken from a river side as it is prohibited to the public. "

"An ethnographic and archaelogical museum built in 1933. It houses a photo gallery and exhibits artifacts describing the way of life of different ethnic groups of the country before Spanish colonization."
"The first railway line in South America. Displayed on site is one of the first trains than ran from Asunción to Encarnacion. This is now used more for concerts, theater shows, and recitals. "
National Museum of Fine Arts of Asunción
Founded in 1909 by the intellectual Juan Silvano Godoy at the time of Paraguay nation reconstruction.
"This favorite place displays modern paintings to pre-Columbian and indigenous crafts, to political caricatures of prominent Paraguayans."
"Grabadores Del Cabichui 2716 E/ Emeterio Miranda y Canada, Asuncion C.P. 1827"
"A longtime local favorite, the delectable Paraguayan cuisine it features should not be missed. "
"Traditional cafe established in 1960 that serves everything from sandwiches to curried rabbit to garlic pizza."
"The city's most popular historic diner and meeting place for its sidewalk tables opposite the Panteón de los Héroes."
"Central: Palma y Chile (Centro); Villamorra - Cruz del Chaco (Manzana T)"
"One of the city's famous buffet-style restaurant serving delicious meats, salad, pasta, sushi, and creative desserts."
"Inaugurated in September 1, 1996, it is one of the most important shopping malls in the country."
"San Blas, Quesada 5050 between Charles de Gaulle and Tte. Zotti"
"The nightlife and food center of the country!"
"Located 5 minutes from the main avenues of the city - Mariscal López, Madame Lynch España, San Martin and República Aregentina."
"Avda. Santa Teresa Between Aviadores del Chaco and Herminio Maldonado"
"Opened in 1995, its Paraguay's first shopping center"
"Av. Del Chaco Prof. de Gonzalez, Asuncion 1749"
